article.headline: Mississippi Valley St. 55, Alabama A&M 41
article.story: ITTA BENA, Miss. (AP) -- Jefferey Price scored 12 points and Mississippi Valley State forced 22 turnovers to beat Alabama A&M 55-41 on Saturday in its Southwestern Athletic Conference opener. The Delta Devils' defense tallied 13 steals and held the Bulldogs to 24 percent shooting in the first half as they took a 31-17 lead at halftime. Neither team shot better than 32 percent in the game. Richard Cannon added eight points and five rebounds for Mississippi Valley State (4-9, 1-0 SWAC), which had 11 turnovers to 12 assists. Cornelius Hester scored 11 points and LaNorris Smith added 10 for Alabama A&M (5-8, 0-2 SWAC), which hit 3 of 18 3-pointers.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
